instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No mouse and no keyboard (because of screen)
threads.message:
Hey 

Duke can you explain what (rail) got fucked up here?

Computer came in with mouse and keyboard freezing 2 seconds after OS loads (but working fine in boot manager)

It came form an AASP who had told the customer it was a Logic Board issue. I then put a known good Logic Board into the casing to test. Error remains... So it is a "casing issue". Fine I then replace the top case as I think it is probably the trackpad/cable. Error remains... I then tested with another display assembly and the freezing stops. I ended up just replacing the LCD-cable.

But I keep wondering what could make this issue - I have never seen a defective LCD-cable make the trackpad and keyboard unresponsive.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No mouse and no keyboard (because of screen)
threads.message: Not sure but I doubt the eDP interface would cause this. Maybe a fucked camera can cause issues.
